reviewText:
Early Access Review

Edit: The RCTW developers have actually been very proactive in communicating with the community and fixing what needs to be fixed. Since this review was written, there have been several bug fixes and graphical improvements made to the game. While the game still has it's slew of bugs and some needed changes to gameplay (the path system still sucks but they're working on a redesign), it is better than when it first launched. While I still can't recommend this game in it's current state, I have no doubt that if Nvissio continues to act on the feedback of the players, this will actually turn into a worthy successor in the RCT franchise.

Graphics: 6/10
Better looking than its twelve year old predecessor, but still dated for 2016	Gameplay: 4/10
While the coaster builder is fun, bugs and minor annoyances detract from its overall enjoyment and poor optimization means even the most powerful computer might only scratch 15 fps.Series Innovation: 5/10
While a lot was added to this entry (fully customizable coaster builder, restaurants, curved and larger size paths) a lot was also taken away. The amount of rides and coaster styles you can build is less than what it was in its predecessors, and you can’t build rides that go underground or roller coasters that don’t connect to the end (e.g shuttle loops).Overall: 5/10
Rollercoaster Tycoon World (RCTW) has the potential to be a worthy addition to the famed Rollercoaster Tycoon (RCT) series, but in it's current state it's bogged down by bugs, missing features, and a stack of minor annoyances which shouldn't exist in a game after two years of development.
I absolutely loved the first three RCT games and in 2014 when RCTW was first announced I was excited to see what the newest game could bring after ten years of new and improved gaming technology. Then the original developer was replaced, and the replacement developer was also replaced and the release date for RCTW kept getting pushed back from its initial “early 2015” date. Finally, at the end of Q1 in 2016, Nvissio and Atari released their Early Access Beta, a year after originally planned, and still not the final release. After playing RCTW for a couple of hours, I must say that I am somewhat disappointed in the progress that has been made after two years.

While the graphics are improved from it’s predecessor, RCT3, the game does look dated for 2016 and what game engines and computers are capable of (at a 1GB download I was kind of expecting that). Polygon reduction when zooming out is very noticeable, and trees go from leafy to a three shaded blob without any middleground. Additionally, the park visitors just look kind of… weird. They have a tendency to run almost wildly flailing their arms which just looks funny and the look only marginally better than their now twelve year senior counterparts. Rides on the other hand do look much better than back in 2004, but look more like they would be in a game released four or five years ago, not now.

The game is hampered by a number of bugs, with many people reporting that the game won’t load past 57% ( I have not had this issue myself). Additionally, there are issues with the game freezing and crashing at random times during gameplay, and on the “Frolicking Forest” map, the terrain editor only removes the polygons of the terrain and you still can’t place paths or rides unless they are above the previous terrain height.

Gameplay wise, it’s actually kind of fun but there are a lot of annoyances that really cut away at it after only a few minutes. The coaster builder is pretty fun, but it’s also pretty hard to just get a straight line out of it. It would also benefit from having a stand alone coaster builder built into the game instead of only having the option to load a map and build it during a game. Additionally, for a “beta” there is a wide variety of shops and stalls, but it is very limited ride wise, with only a handful of roller coaster styles and a few different “flat rides” with varying scenery to choose from which seems interesting considering it’s a game built around building rides at its core. Additionally, the roller coasters have to connect, no more building shuttle loops for an easy payday. The main annoyance that’s been plaguing me is that there is no area demolish. Every bush, shrub, and tree that is there when the map loads needs to be individually clicked on to destroy, with is rather tedious. I do like that there are now larger paths that can be built, but there are times when the game won’t let me make a straight path, especially when making a short path that connects to another path. Another annoyance is that you have to build shops and stalls offset from the main path, and have to build a path to connect it to the main path which adds in an extra step and is also tedious, especially when your path doesn’t want to just go straight.

Playing RCTW, you can see hints of the potential that this entry has, and with some polish and more development work, I do think that this can be a good game. However, with the way Atari has been treating this game over the past two years, I don’t really believe any major amount of progress will be made, and the game will forever be one of those “What could have been” examples.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is really sad for me. I've been a RCT fan since the first one, and I was overly excited to RCTW as the start when Atari announced back in 2014. Just bought it in November, I was upset with the launch delay, but ok, I understood.

But now, this EA (which is not an beta or alpha) looks really bad. I gotta say, not everything, but here are certain things that really dissapointed me, and I hope that Nvizzio will fix. Some of them was in the previous RCT games.

- Everything is just too much big. (Even the food store, which I think is the smallest thing in the game)
- The path tool didn't work to attach some things (some ridiculous things, it's hard to attach the queue lines in those)
- You have NO CONTROL of the employees, and it's unnecessary to need a giant building to hire them. (You can't even set a specific place for them to stay)
- There's no research for the things just like was before. You can unlock the things only completing the goals. I didn't like it.
- You have very poor information and control of the guests (You can't ammount them by sorting the thinking or the feeling.
- A simple roller coaster (yeah, really small and smooth track) it's getting a extreme-high level of Nausea, making about 80% of the people throwing their stomachs out by the exit of the track, making the paths incredible dirty.

I will not talk about the graphics, the lagging, the low frame rate, and the visual of the peeps, which you can find more complains here in another review.

It's playable. But it's kinda sad, really is. And don't worth the paying right now.
I hope they'll fix all of this soon, making me change this review. I really hope.

6/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The RollerCoaster Tycoon games have been a staple part of my gaming life since I was a knee high to a grass hopper....RollerCoaster tycoon world has ended this run with a game that doesn't deserve to be associated with its forebears.

Firstly, I know this is an Early Access game and shouldn't expect too much, but this was a true disappointment.  I have a fairly high end rig and this game ran pathetically; peeps don't walk and glide, fps is very low, coaster builder is laggy.  The graphics are just terrible, barely upgraded from RCT3.  The water is just dreadful....why does it look like copper sulphate solutions?! It's not that blue!

The coaster builder is a double-edged sword...the potential to build anything you want is brilliant...you can make the coaster into exactly what you want...it is just so damn fiddly!  One great positive is the testing stats overlay that you get...it highlights the areas of the coaster that has the highest nausea inducing spirals that can really help when trying to perfect a ride as well as pointing out where the excitement is highest; that aspect is brilliant.

All in all, I feel really disappointed with this game.  The number of bugs is staggering and issues is staggering.  I really wanted to love this game, but as it stands at the moment, I just can't.  In some respects, the developers have listened to the community from the pre-alpha but it still has light-years to go before I would recommend.

I just hope that the developers really try and fix this....otherwise its the end of a great series.  So far, the developers have certainly been fixing the major issues with posts and that.  I remain confident that with some time and feedback, they will turn this into the game that it should be.

EDIT 4/4/16:  Having played the game for a bit longer now, I can see the potential in this game about what could be.  Having changed the graphics settings to their highest (the autoconfig didn't do this) and their not actually that bad, so you can ignore that from my previous review!  I think I would upgrade my initial review slightly, but at its current state, I still can't recommend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The development of this game has been a rollercoaster of high intensity and nasuea. Originally intended to be released late 2015, they have switched to releasing it now as early access. For many (including me), the game suffers from performance problems. I do want to see if the game is improving, but I'm still behind a performance wall. Many have given up on this game and looked towards some similar alternatives (like revisiting the older games), but a small sliver of me is still curious about the fate of this game.

When I'm able to play this game to a better extent, I'll re-review it. But for now, don't buy it (especially for such a high price).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I truly belive this will be a great game once it's finally finished, but for now there are some serious problems.  My main complaint is with the new paths engine.  This is the way you build and connect paths and queues in the game, and it is borderline unusable becuase connecting to existing paths is difficult and building grid-aligned paths has been made harder in order to support more organic shapes.  The developers claim this is one area of focus for improvement, which is the only redeeming factor.
Beyond that, there are various graphic bugs I've noticed while playing and sometimes the rides just stop running and need a manual stop and start.  The game itself has even locked up while loading and exiting.  Maybe in a couple updates I can change this review, but for now, older versions of the game are better.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For this review I am gonna do a fair comparsion between RCTW another game in the same genre: Planet Coaster

1 Game Basics

1.1 Graphic

Planet Coaster 8/10
Good Color Filter and good cartoon graphic in general, very good!

Rollercoaster Tycoon World 4/10
Bad Color Filter, too yellow and grey, graphic is bad as a game released in 2009, park detail is horriable and store models are repeated.

1.2 Sound

Planet Coaster 9/10
I really like the catchy BGM in the main menu and devs also use the BGM properly in every detail of the game (like the one played when the park is loaded and we start playing).

Rollercoaster Tycoon World 6/10
Not Bad Background Music, still the same style (but changed a bit) of the 1st and 2nd generation.

1.3 HUD (UI)
Planet Coaster 6/10
Generic Park Simluation UI, the globe in the main menu is static and not rotatable, and the icons on it are repeated, very ugly. Please redesign it.

Rollercoaster Tycoon World 7/10
Simple and beautiful flat designed UI, with cool animation, easy to get started, but there are some translation errors and menu selection bugs at the current stage, which should be fixed after I believe.

2 Game Elements

2.1 Rides

Planet Coaster 8/10
Rides totally functioned and animated beautifully, guests can interact with the rides perfectly, coaster can be easily built and mounted.

Rollercoaster Tycoon World 7/10
Rides totally functioned and animated beautifully, guests can interact with the rides but due to the awful guest model, it's ugly, coaster can be easily built and mounted.

2.2 Guests

Planet Coaster 9/10
Perfect cartoon guest art style, featured tons of differnet animation which makes the park alive and artistic, but guest types are too narrow, too repeated.

Rollercoaster Tycoon World 0/10
Totally piece of sh1+, dumbass motherfcker super b1+ch puzzy cun+. What the FK is this? Guest? Peep? I'd better which Justin Bieber dancing rather than watching those lame cheap craps walking and running. Don't release the game until the designers who designed those guests are fired by Atari.

2.3 Park Landscape

Planet Coaster 8/10
Great Lanscapes, piece by piece building system (MOD), very good vista and flexiable terrain system with infinte possibilites. And many themes available.

Rollercoaster Tycoon World 5/10
Acceptable but still needs to be polished, the cars parked outside are repeated and meaning nothing, and there are only 2 types of themes (meadowland and western). Vista is super ugly,

2.4 Path

Planet Coaster 3/10
Very bad path algorithm. I can not build stright paths and build linear stations, too bad, please redesign your algorithm for path system.

Rollercoaster Tycoon World 6/10
Path system is OK. I can build stright and bend paths as I want but still a little bit harder. And another very bad thing is the path seems to be floating on the land surface instead of stay right on the land surface, which makes the game looks cheaper.

3 Extra
For the rest of the parts such as optimization, advanced graphic or steam workshops and so on, I am not gonna review at the current stage because the game is not actually finished.

Final Score:
Planet Coaster
(8+9+6+8+9+8+3) / 7 = 7.3
Rollercoaster Tycoon World
(4+6+7+7+0+5+6) / 7 = 5.0

This game is not ready to be published.  If they would just  play the game for like 5 hours before releasing it, they would know that the game is messed up.  The system of deletion and snapping are jacked.  The mechanics get stuck and stop working.  The thoughts of the peeps just dissapear, never to return, but don't worry, they still get mad.

There is no easy way to find where your staff are, or figure out what they are doing.

If you make the angle of the path exiting your rides at any more than 45 degrees, it won't allow you to make the queue and visa versa.

I've also had a little trouble with connecting new paths to already built 1paths (not an issue of angle),

The maintnence guys go back in as soon as they come out of the door of the buildig.  If they do make it out, pretty much all 10 of them are stuck together walking around.

I am very dissapointed with this game.  I love the idea.  The problem that I see is that in the last couple of years, many gaame makers have been giving us broken games.  This is unacceptable.  The game litterally doesn't function.  I feel like I should be able to return this garbage and maybe buy it back if the designers get their crap together.

It's appears that they focused so much on how the game would look, that they completely neglected making sure that if functioned propely

reviewText:
Early Access Review

We can take for granted that an early access game will be rough round the edges, and we must be prepared for plenty of quirks and bugs.
However one has to wonder just how far into the development this game is, when core functionality is so fundamentally broken.
Take as an example, when you begin a campaign, besides a extreme stutter, which I will get into shortly, after picking one of just three areas to start in, you will often find yourself with only one build option; rides.
Granted, the intention is of course that different creation options will unlock for you as you progress in the game, however on numerous occasions, besides the rides category, the other options would unlock much later than necessary (that is assuming they ever unlock). Like in the previous Rollercoaster Tycoon games, you need to place rides and shops far enough from the paths to provide space for a substantial length of an entrance queue. After placing a number of rides, you may notice that you have no means of drawing a path to them. What this leads to is hundreds of visitors entering the park after paying the £5 entrance fee, merely to walk back and forth on the small stretch of preset pathway at the entrace, getting increasingly tired and frustrated, and feeling understandably ripped off. To make things worse, if you have opened those rides in the vain hope that these visitors will get off the beaten path and make the trek across the grass to ride the helter skelter (heads up: they won't), soon enough the rides will inevitably break down simply from normal test usage. Nevermind, you can get mechanics on the job because it looks like the Buildings category finally opened up! Oh wait, you can't build a pathway. Right, that's really brought things to a halt.

The interface adds insult to injury when notifications pop up, giving you a series of requests like hey
recommended: can you please add some lamps?" or "hey your customers can't get to this ride
hoursPlayed: can you build a pathway to it?"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Holy mother of god. Absolutely awful. 107 minutes in and I just couldn't take the mess any more. Already requested and received my refund.  This game was supposed to be out months ago... and here we are, 3 months late, and it's still 'early access'? I can understand a few glitches here and there, but this is ridiculous. 60% of the time, the game won't load, and when it does load, functions of the game won't turn off when switched on..... for example, I turned on the 'heat map' feature to find my most popular ride. The heat map would not disable and conveniently covered the menu button so I could not save and reload the game... 45 minutes of game gone to a rookie league glitch. The peeps are glitchy and half of them just 'float' instead of actually walk and move... the ride camera stops working and the peeps on the ride appear to detach from the ride and kind of hover over the seats.. this game that is incredibly late is almost unplayable.

I wanted to like it. I really did. I've loved the genre since game 1, but Atari really screwed the pooch. I will be buying Planet Coaster which is made by the same people who created the first 2 rollercoaster tycoon games... Atari merely bought the name rollercoaster tycoon" and destroyed it.

Awful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I decided to play longer then a few hours before writing a review. I'm clocking a little over 20 hours in this game at the moment and all in all I am not to positive about it.

I loved RCT 1 and 2. I played 3 shortly but never got around to actually properly playing it. I have also never been good at building coasters and actually don't quite enjoy doing that. I just put down pre-made coasters and try to get the goals I need to get. So for me as a very casual gamer it all just needs to be simple.

This game can be simple if you give it a chance.

Suprisingly I am actually attempting to build coasters. The builder is a little confusing at first and it took me a while to properly understand the controls and how it all works but I feel that I sort of got the hang of it. They're not the most awesome coasters but I actually enjoyed making them and trying to get them to work and not crash. However some parts are still confusing to me when I try to build and especially with the add-ons like twists and loopings and they give me an error and I cannot continue to build. So I avoid adding those which is immidiatly what does dissapoint me about this builder. I should be able to just add these things. The fact that there is very little explaination as you first start building doesn't help either and for some odd reason I cannot get the tutorials to work so I'm stuck on that.

Overall the coaster builder is not bad.

Now for everything else. I like the designs of the flat rides but at the same time I wish I could edit them. Because I like the size and how they made it I would like to be able to change the colours and such. I miss that. I also feel like there aren't enough rides or even pre-made coasters. I assume thats where the steam workshop comes into play but I haven't quite gotten around to looking at that. I mostly miss water rides. There is a few that have water around them which makes them look cool but no actual water rides. But I miss the monorail type rides the most of all. I don't quite understand why those are not in here.

The shops also miss customizing but I do like the variety in them. Especially the restaurants though it would also be great if peeps stopped saying they're hungry while I built all of them and there is a place to eat every few steps. I'm not quite sure how you can be hungry then.

Paths....those are just bad. Atleast to connect paths is just not fun at all. I don't quite understand why I cannot connect a path from a restaurant to the main path the way I want it placed. I don't want some odd kink in it. I don't want to have to lenght it further just so it will connect to a certain piece of the main path. Since when does path making have to be so frusterating? Because that is just what it is. Frusterating.

Scenery. I am missing so many things in here. All my parks start to look the same because there simply isn't enough variety. Not to mention that I cannot place things on the path 85% of the time! Why can't I just place a simple bench on the path? Also bridges. I cannot place anything on path bridges so no wonder those are a mess since I cannot even put trash cans on them. Scenery needs severe improving.

Workers. In one of the loading screens it tells me that I can adjust things in the building screen for my workers...I have yet to figure this out. I cannot assign workers to certain areas. Picking them up makes my screen flicker so that doesn't help and I simply cannot adjust anything about any of my workers. Not work clothes, not areas they walk or who does what.

The land tool. I like my lands flat. I have yet to learn how to work with the flatten tool as it just does weird stuff. It doesn't flatten that I do know. It would be a great improvement if you can just click on the area you want flattened and it instantly does so.

So far I do not have any issues with the game completely crashing and only once has it become super slow (most likely due to taking up too much memory but these are things I know nothing about).

So all in all I would not recommend this game right now. If it improves then yes as this game has a lot of potential for both casual gamers and more die hard gamers who love to built stuff.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So I decided to play longer then a few hours before writing a review. I'm clocking a little over 20 hours in this game at the moment and all in all I am not to positive about it.

I loved RCT 1 and 2. I played 3 shortly but never got around to actually properly playing it. I have also never been good at building coasters and actually don't quite enjoy doing that. I just put down pre-made coasters and try to get the goals I need to get. So for me as a very casual gamer it all just needs to be simple.

This game can be simple if you give it a chance.

Suprisingly I am actually attempting to build coasters. The builder is a little confusing at first and it took me a while to properly understand the controls and how it all works but I feel that I sort of got the hang of it. They're not the most awesome coasters but I actually enjoyed making them and trying to get them to work and not crash. However some parts are still confusing to me when I try to build and especially with the add-ons like twists and loopings and they give me an error and I cannot continue to build. So I avoid adding those which is immidiatly what does dissapoint me about this builder. I should be able to just add these things. The fact that there is very little explaination as you first start building doesn't help either and for some odd reason I cannot get the tutorials to work so I'm stuck on that.

Overall the coaster builder is not bad.

Now for everything else. I like the designs of the flat rides but at the same time I wish I could edit them. Because I like the size and how they made it I would like to be able to change the colours and such. I miss that. I also feel like there aren't enough rides or even pre-made coasters. I assume thats where the steam workshop comes into play but I haven't quite gotten around to looking at that. I mostly miss water rides. There is a few that have water around them which makes them look cool but no actual water rides. But I miss the monorail type rides the most of all. I don't quite understand why those are not in here.

The shops also miss customizing but I do like the variety in them. Especially the restaurants though it would also be great if peeps stopped saying they're hungry while I built all of them and there is a place to eat every few steps. I'm not quite sure how you can be hungry then.

Paths....those are just bad. Atleast to connect paths is just not fun at all. I don't quite understand why I cannot connect a path from a restaurant to the main path the way I want it placed. I don't want some odd kink in it. I don't want to have to lenght it further just so it will connect to a certain piece of the main path. Since when does path making have to be so frusterating? Because that is just what it is. Frusterating.

Scenery. I am missing so many things in here. All my parks start to look the same because there simply isn't enough variety. Not to mention that I cannot place things on the path 85% of the time! Why can't I just place a simple bench on the path? Also bridges. I cannot place anything on path bridges so no wonder those are a mess since I cannot even put trash cans on them. Scenery needs severe improving.

Workers. In one of the loading screens it tells me that I can adjust things in the building screen for my workers...I have yet to figure this out. I cannot assign workers to certain areas. Picking them up makes my screen flicker so that doesn't help and I simply cannot adjust anything about any of my workers. Not work clothes, not areas they walk or who does what.

The land tool. I like my lands flat. I have yet to learn how to work with the flatten tool as it just does weird stuff. It doesn't flatten that I do know. It would be a great improvement if you can just click on the area you want flattened and it instantly does so.

So far I do not have any issues with the game completely crashing and only once has it become super slow (most likely due to taking up too much memory but these are things I know nothing about).

So all in all I would not recommend this game right now. If it improves then yes as this game has a lot of potential for both casual gamers and more die hard gamers who love to built stuff.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After playing this game some more and mysteriously having my key revoked without a refund, I have decided that this game is the biggest heap of ♥♥♥♥ to ever enter Steam since Rome 2 Total War.

Growing up on RCT2 and RCT3 (yes, I am that young), which were both incredible games, my expectations for this game were extremely high.

It was fraught with problems. At first I forgave them, because it was in Early Access.

Let's start with the positives (of which there are few), though. We have to give this game a chance, right?

Good things:
-Snazzy new coaster builder
-Snazzy new paths builder
-I REALLY like the new restaurants which replace basic food stands
-Cars in coaster trains can be different colours
-The new water tool isn't efficient at all but it's top banter

That's it.
Anyway, back to the negatives (of which there are many):

Not only did I learn that this game was not made by the original developers, but I also noticed more and more things that are catastrophically wrong with this game. For a start, it's massively overpriced.

Then you get into the rollercoaster ratings. I simply cannot get anywhere in the campaigns because rollercoasters are rated as high intensity WAYYYY too easily, and in order to make a 'coaster that is exciting at all, it needs to have pretty much ultra-extreme intensity... so nobody rides it and you just lost 20,000 monies, pal.

You only have a small amount of music choices, and they are just variations of exactly the same tune in a depressingly low quality, which drives you bloody insane in five minutes.

Sometimes when you place custom tracks using the snazzy new spline coaster builder, you cannot add another section because the new secton has to be a pre-built track. This is probably hard to understand, and we face a dilemma because in order to properly understand you need to play the game, but that is something you absolutely do not want to do.

I thought I could deal with the supports problem but it is SO common that it is UNFORGIVEABLE. It is so infuriating to have a nice creation utterly ruined and the immersion completely shattered by a track support going through the middle of your loop.

But BY FAR THE WORST PROBLEM is the optimisation. Having spent £960 on a computer, which I have to say is a very good one, you'd expect to get good performance on this game. Right?

NOOOO!

On the very lowest settings on a flat map with a couple of rollercoasters, my computer struggles to reach 20fps. On a map with varied terrain and many rollercoasters, I might as well be watching a slideshow.

I will now proceed to wait impatiently for Planet Coaster, after learning that it was actually made by the developers of RCT3 and it's not just a cheap knockoff of the RCT series. You want to know what a cheap knockoff of the RCT series is?

This game.

Early Access Review

I'm a fan of the Roller Coaster Tycoon Franchise. I own RCT3. I was very excited to get my hands on this early access game. I was EXTREMELY disappointed. BUT, I was not able to play the game... At All... First off, i don't have the best computer, but it runs BeamNG Drive, Gmod, and other games bought on steam fine. When i first loaded a Sandbox park, my FPS dropped to about 0-10. I ignored that and started to build a Hyper Coaster. I could barely change the direction of the station. I scrolled my mouse wheel, then a few seconds later the station turned. I hovered over the thing where you design the track, then a few seconds later it allowed me to build the track. I would probably love this game if i could actually play it.

So the point of my review is: You need a $600+ computer to run this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I was NOT pleasantly surprised by this disappointing Early Access simulation. The interface offers very few options for tailoring the way you move around, and in its present form is frustratingly clumsy. Paths and Cues are hard to join up. Path lights and rubbish bins wont install on any path that is elevated, so some large parts of your park are in darkness. There doesn't appear to be any way of placing paths and tracks through hills, and etc.

This game is not worth it for the price you pay. If it had been half what I paid for it (knowing that later I would have to buy addons like the RCT franchise has always worked) I may have taken the time to give feedback, and bide my time with it.

Conclusion: Don't waste your money. By something else like I did.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is just my initial impressions.

The game has issues yes, However I would like to see it succeed, I really want a good RCT game again! The game industry has not had a decent theme park simulator in such a long time. And this year we are expecting two, I want both to do well :)

My biggest issue so far is the path system. It's very VERY fidgity at the moment, I would like to see it improved, maybe some option to not have rounded path ends (unless I missed it).

The coaster builder take some time to get used to, It's not bad but not great either. I try my best to create realistic feeling roller coasters but it does take quite a bit of patience to create a coaster without having the intensity be really high or nausea rating really high.

I like that there is the option of flexibility and not fitting things to a grid. But even with the grid or snap turned on I still struggle to get things to fit in place or line up, Again especially with the path system.

The look of the game is not that bad! It's definatley nicer than the first Atari Trailer released. Although I think this is a different studio to that one. It's not super duper detailed, but the gameplay needs way more improvement than graphics at this point. Graphics are not everything but framerate issues are a thing in this game. For the most part it's smoothe but I have experienced the daunting screen jitter and lag too. This is annoyingly a big thing on the coasters however, especially the coaster cam when it comes to turning corners! Really needs to be smoothed out.

At its current state it needs a lot of polish! Better AI on the peeps, refined coaster builder and path system, improved coaster cam and PLEASE get rid of that annoying white highlight whenever I hover over a ride (especially on the coasters).

Oh and be able to demolish stuff while building...

For the price I would expect this game to be really polished, bug free and just... FUN by release! There is another tough competition out there (You know the one), but I do wish you success with this franchise, If not the future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game demands a lot out of the cpu, FAR more then the recommended spec, so either the spec is a lie or the game is SERIOUSLY un optimized.

This wouldn't be an issue, if the game wasn't delayed so damn long making me believe that it will never get fixed.

This is compounded with a shocking lack of content, and questionable time management, as the food stalls have 3-5 themes each, while rides and coasters are lacking.

The little positives things I can say about the game are its far easier to build a working coaster and get people to ride them then prior games, building the roller coasters is fun but when ridden first person you see how lumpy the things are even when building them with the button placements apposed to the... what is this called, nurbs... I don't know, I don't like that way to build coasters at all.

I don't know whats under the hood of if its fixable but there is no excuse for how badly this game runs.

Lets also be clear, I'm no fan of planet coaster and think so many aspects of that game are worse then this one, largely due to me not being creative enough to build custom things that look nice. If you want a roller coaster game, rct2 with the opencrt2 mod, some people love rct3, or the new and possibly best roller coaster game, Parkitect are what you should be looking at, the 2 big hitters (this and planet coaster) rely to much on mods and community to be fun for me... I mean how much worse can I feel when people put crap up with the in game tools and I cant make a single thing look presentable?

Its entirely possible this game will turn around, be very optimized and with mods be the best game around... and if it is ill buy it again then, but I'm not holding out hope.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Please people, do not buy this game in its current state!

The first release was a buggy beta, okay, no problem just fix the annoyances it before going public. Then they extended the releasedate with 3 months. Great! I hope the game will benefit.  But nope, almost all of the complaints made with the pretty unplayable beta 5 months ago still remain in the game. And if a developer does not fix the main problems in the game within 5 months I lose my trust in this game becoming anything great. I tried to like it,  I really tried, but its clunky controls and camera ruined it all, just like in the beta.

I had such high hopes, especially with the extended release date and the great competition that is Planet Coaster and Parkitect. I hoped that they would learn from those games and see how it should have been done. But no, the controls are still clunky, the game still sound terrible and  the worst is that most anoyances like fence placement still hasn't been fixed. It's not that they didn't do anything these months, they implemented the peeps, more rides, a piece by piece coaster builder, a strange campaign and graphics options. But no fixing the main problems...

So in short, if you want to play a new game like Rollercoaster Tycoon 3, buy Planet Coaster which is in early alpha right now on their website and if you want to play a game like RCT1/RCT2 buy Parkitect which is also in early alpha and should arrive at steam in a few months. But please don't be as stupid as me, please don't buy this game in its current state. I really hope they can turn the sinking ship around and still make a great game of it after Early access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Remember how the earlier RCT games motivated you to really go out of your way to create an amazing theme park even if just making basic things that don't make any structural sense work just as fine?
I don't get that feeling of excitement from this game; playing it feels like a chore.

I really couldn't beleive the game was as terrible as the reviews make it out to be, but it really is boring and uninspired.
The new coaster builder is very sloppy and confusing, the menus are unintuitive the tutorial is way too long and doesn't even properly explain you where everything is, and the new rating system is broken; why change something that worked perfectly in 3 previous games?!

Sorry for my ranting, but this game is not good. I might give it another shot once the full game releases but as of now, I'm not touching this early access ever again.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am a big fan of RCT1 and 2 with all expansions they made. In fact RCT 1 was the best. So many levels you can play with different goals and lovly created maps. You really can see how much love the developers sent to RCT 1 and 2. But after RCT 3 was released it wasn't mine at all. The gameplay wasn't the focus anymore. Instead the graphics and the possibilties to drive your coasters were gone to be focused. But there were no lovely levels at all anymore.... So far to the old ones....

Now to RCT W: This game, in fact, is nice to watch. The graphics are very well created and animated.... but that's, by far, is all I can review positve at all.
I mean, you have to know it's still an Early-Access so it's still under development. But: There are so many bugs that the game is still unplayable. The service personals are stuck on roads. They neither move nor do their work. Some functions told in tips can't be used, e.g. the service personal's route. You can't change or even select anythin like this.
The placement of roads, coasters and buildings are terrible. You made a road and cross it with another. Then, because of the crossing point, you aren't even able to put bins or banks onto the roads or lanterns.... Banks, bins or anything like these are small tiles which cannot be placed on a big road because another is crossing it... there is a big place you cannot build onto... Hope they fix it...

People's movement is broken. They do not walk over the raods, they are flying over it when you scroll out of the map.
The pathfinding is better then in RCT 1 where people run completly random on the raods. Here they take the way they want to get the coaster of their choice. But the movement is still buggy and broken...

And at least, to make it more funny... I only have a notebook with notebok graphics... but it is still a GTX980M. One of the heigher graphic cards.... and After each building and attraction my framerate drops little lower... I begin this game with 60 FPS. After 3 Coasters and several other attractions my frames cannot climb over 21 per seconds.... That's not normal... I have tested different maps and coaster types and everytime the same issues... Building more attractions decrease FPS. Seems that the graphic is rendering everything in the park even if you are not focusing the attraction in the active window.... And by that: The game is using 3 GB RAM (active) and the cpu-usage ist too damned high... Even a mondern shooter or anything like that is not using more 20% of cpu  (got a Intel core i7-4720 HQ) but this game is using up to 70%... I do not know whether the cpu is supporting the graphics and whether the graphics are made within the cpu... but at this level with all this bugs and mistakes and mismakes... the game isn't worth to be bought... And never worth to be bought at this price...

I will look forwards for updates and may update this review when updates make it better... otherwise I won't spend any time at all in wrinting for this game... Seems that I need to look closer to planet coaster too :/

Chris Sawyer.... please come back and rescue this amazing game you made early we all loved

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have played and loved the RollerCoaster Tycoon games for years. Unfortunately I do have to agree with a lot of the negative reviews.
The game is nowhere near ready. It's poorly optimized, very buggy and is missing important features. But on saying that it is a early access game so I didn't expect it to be perfect.
I love building rollercoasters, I never used pre made coasters in RCT3 and I don't plan to in this either but after 2 hours of trying to build a coaster I gave up because you have to mess about with to many things just to get the right angle on the track. I do like the fact that there are more options in coaster building but I think they took it slightly to far.
A few things I want to see in the game is a 'basic' and 'advanced' option on coaster building, basic being the same as RCT3. Edge scrolling is a must for me to, I hate having to move the camera around with the keyboard all the time. Bulldozing is annoying to as you can only delete a single thing at a time so if you have a load of trees, plants or scenery you want to get rid of it takes ages! They need to add a click and drag system to delete multiple things at once and when placing objects and rides, auto delete trees and plants that are in the way.
I could go on but at the moment I can't recommend buying this game. The devs are saying they are working hard on the game but it isn't getting many updates yet.
I really hope they get this game right in the end but its looking like 2 or 3 months before I can make a final decision.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have only a little time with the game, regardless of what my hours played says, because I left it running while I was working on mods. Overall, I can't really recommend it. The one time I  actually tried to play the campaign, it crashed on me within 10 minutes.

Pros:

Creating a model and getting it into the game is super easy if you're familiar with Unity. I spent almost all my free time this weekend modeling and then testing it in the game. I'm going to enjoy making models for this game.

Game is looking better. It still needs some work, but I feel there's a good balance between graphics and performance.

Cons:

Crashed within 10 minutes of actually attempting to play the campaign. I'm not interested in sandbox mode except to test my models; I want the management sim part of the game as much as the rest.

Modding side of the game is sorely missing some features, like the ability to give names to the individual models in a pack, set their prices, and give them descriptions.

Seriously lacking in decoratives. Sure, we can fill that section out, but they should provide a fair number of them, too.

Could never download anyone else's UGC. It always hung up on me.

04/21 Edit: UGC is still messed up after latest (04/20) patch. Most of the time I can't even see the UGC I made, and I can only see some of what other people made.

----------

I expect to change my review some day, but unless you want to make scenery objects for the game, I'd hold out on buying it right now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

While the new RollerCoaster Tycoon World early access, it is quite clear there are some major flaws. Althought it plays a huge factor in the judgement of the game, it is also essential to note that the game is in early access and undergoing developement. But, the tragedy this game has brought me through is simply no exception for the franchise, RollerCoaster Tycoon World better get it's s*** together before release. Aside from that, I am here to shed some light on why the game is so bad right now and why you shouldn't waste your money on this game if it continues in this downhill spiral.

Pros:
Rollercoaster building is new and innovative
The game allows more freedom for the player
Dive Coasters are a great addition to the list
Stations and chain lifts are better

Cons (brace yourselves):
Lack of coasters and rides you can build
TONS of major bugs involving building placement and tracks
The game may be too free for those who like to keep things straight
You can't pick up people anymore :(
Game has some s*** graphics for some major lag
Coaster camera is somewhat stiff
Coaster train editing is bland
Coaster entertainment means you can't build scary s*** or no one will ride it cause they're p******
(Seriously, one drop and a loop will put your coaster to a 1 in excitement)
HEIGHT LIMITS!!! (Hyper coasters can't even go past 300)
The price of the damn game for this s***
No chain lift catwalk beneath for inverted coasters
Only one side of chainlift for most regular coaster
Really? no undoing a mistake (RIP Ctrl + Z)
UI makes me want to commit Seppeku
Parks are dirty as s*** even with loads of janitors
NO WATER RIDES
EA would prob do a better job at making this game
Career mode is a joke
I prob missed some stuff but you get the point.

INB4 9/10 -IGN

But seriously, keep your wallets safe out there kids.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game has potential to be something great... buuut with how it's looking so far, and from what i hear about the plans for it in the future, i can't possibly see myself enjoying this game very much. Why? i'll explain...

First off, the small little rides you can set up here and there (ferris wheels, gravitron, merry go round, etc) are all nice and work flawlessly... But the moment I try building a  coaster, it just starts eating up SO MUCH MEMORY.

Yes, this game uses up so much memory and processing, it's insane. It's definitely NOT optimized what so ever. I'm on a high end computer that can run just about every single game i have on here on max settings with flawless performance... but for some reason, this particular game, whenever I try building a coaster, or even spawn a premade one, it freezes up, crashes, and gives me a warning/error saying that too much memory is being used. Then java stops working, aaaand it dies all together. I learned this the hard way when I was spending a lot of time setting up paths, small rides, concessions, etc... and when i finally said Alright

We I first booted the game, I thought I would play the first campaign to get grips with the game, I thought I would bulid a basic park with a few rides.  Surely what could go wrong. Disapearing paths and missing track partk, add a few staff and away you go.

Piles of Sick and broken rides and people not using the toilets. Create a Pre Bulid Coaster its got a extreme nausea rating, So the staff do sweet f all, and we can't even pick them up or see them. Why include stuff which is clearly broken, rather than enabling us to bulid a basic park and add features when neccessary rather including the out of the box.

Yes it may turn out to a decent title, but I would'nt reccomend it at the moment, Played Planet Coaster a week after first playing this early access and was just blown away by the dfifference in quality, I have'nt even tried coaster buliding yet (I am waiting). I am looking forward to Parkitect as well, and I am prepared to suport Kickstarter/EA so I know whether a game has got  potential or not. I played it again to give further opinion and although it has improved , I just can see this hitting there mark, but I could be wrong.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nJust stop it with the bad reviews, get off your high horses and realize what this game is.  Most of the people that are freaking out about it and saying how terrible it is are just not paitent enough to put a little time into and figure out how it works.  Also it's a simulation game for theme parks, not Medal of Honor.  It's a game who's target audience is much younger then most of those playing it right now.  People playing it right now are people that have been playing RCT3 for 10 years, know it backward and forward and were dealing with a game that has three updates.  This is not that yet and if that's what you're looking for then go back to playing RCT3 and stop trying to kill a game that shows a lot of promise, just give it a little time.  Last point, to the people complaining that you are basicallly paying to test ouf a game welcome to reality.  Why should a company pay someone to do it when they can get people to pay them to... duh.  If you don't like it don't do it but stop complaining about it.  This game is much better then it is getting credit for and I believe that in time it will be truly great.

FPS drops when using Q / E keys to rotate (i have on all max settings, tried in 4k and 1440p) Looks like Nvidia HBAO causes this.  Sorry the stuttering is still there / back with HBAO off.

Music tracks for rides sound like they were low sampled

Graphics are better then older titles but ok for this age

No undo button

Debugging spam in output_log.txt in game dir

Crash simulation is bad or not done

Physx is very bad for coasters

Went thru couple of developers

Devs claim 75-85% done

WAIT FOR A SALE  OR  RELEASE CANDIDATE" (not early access unless you get it cheaper)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really wanted it to work, I wished it deeply but in the end...

I don't even know where to begin. Of course my computer isn't a true gem, with a 660m and 8go of RAM, but I tough it met all the required needs to run smoothly. I had to put the game at low, and even then 30-20 FPS max... I was really dissapointed, it was still playable but enjoyable less...

Now more about the game and the gameplay itself. You take RCT3 and you reskin it, even with less fun than RCT3 and you get that game. It's realllly unfinished, but even for an early access not only it lacked of content but you can feel the strugglings of brillant and less brillant ideas that the different stages of this game developpement had to pass by. The HUD is decent but not all the menus are clear. The statistics are really neat but in the end rather unexploited. There was many bugs with the pathway system, and quite frankly it became frustrating and boring to fight with the game itself.

Not that it lacked of great idea but the feeling of testing and indev version of the game made me regret my hopes and seeks for nostalgia as well as refunding the game. Honnestly, maybe in a year it will be worth some money but not yet.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI had my expecatations FAR too high for this game. Honestly I know the beta was horrible but this feels even worse than the first beta! Of course it is Early Access but is this all that they've got. I have only 3 hours on record for this game and I am already refusing to play it. First of all my computer is running two GeForce GTX 980Ti's in SLI along with an Intel i7-6700k and I still get lag! Everytime I click on a flat ride to spawn it in, the game lags for a good 10 seconds and resumes. Hell even coaster building is a huge hassle and it is near impossible to build anything with the difficult controls as well as the horrible optimization issues the game has. Trust me, DO NOT buy this game until it is out of Early Access. For now buy Planet Coaster. Planet Coaster is currently in Alpha but the Alpha for that game it better that this entire game in general. So take my word. DO NOT buy this game, buy Planet Coaster.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To improve

It 'difficult to judge a game in early acces, especially because I do not doubt that will be improved in the future before the final release .... But, here, I was expecting for a long time, and frankly some components could and should in my opinion, you are better managed ... below what goes and what should be improved:

POSITIVE:

1 The camera controls and in general the gameplay found them intuitive, but the view is cumbersome to manage
2 Graphically it is not at the top but it reflects the fairytale style of the series, although it changed the software company, that someone may like
3 Fair administrative, functional graphs and summary that you can display with various options that can give depth to the management side.
4 It is not as fun as I hoped

NEGATIVE:

1 Too much speed of movement of the screen characters and amusement rides, carousel horses seemed to have the turbo, I had nausea for my clients.

2 Full Economic Charts, as mentioned before, but not at all reflect the real costs that can be expected, the construction of a carousel can not cost $ 600, and a lamppost 4 euro. The daily takings are not at all in line with the monthly report, Nvizzio should review this issue to make it more realistic,

3 I find the negative progress of game time, frankly I would have liked days decidedly longer play, in two hours you end up a whole year, much better than a much slower progress, perhaps to last a month what is now the year whole, I think it would be more realisitco, this in my opinion is the most critical.

Finally, I do not recommend it because I am a lover of the genre, and this production has disappointed me, even considering that it is in early acces

Awful, just awful.  I've played every rct since day one.  I'd imagined it would be hard to do worse than RCT 3 but they managed to pull it off.  I don't want to hear excuses that it is early access and everything else.  This games been delayed 2 years!!!

The who system is clunky,  There are way too many key prompts to efficiently make coasters.  The paths don't snap together well, and it ends up being a mess.  The peeps are boring and have no detail.  I played for 56 minutes according to steam, and I quickly left and asked for my refund.   I had such high hopes for this game, and they fell short. Very Short.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*Updated Review From May 26* Rollercoaster Tycoon has gone a long way and has gotten a lot better. I still can't recommend it yet, because it still feels bare bones about a lot of it. Mainly doesnt have much customization yet. But it is getting better with every update. At first I figured they would just dump this game out and call it finished, but they are making a lot of good progress. Another six monthes and it might be enjoyable and recommendable.

*Old Review From March 30th* This game is easily 1/4th that of Rollercoaster Tycoon 3. There's hardly any customization at all when you build a ride. There's tons of vomit. Like one coaster makes easily 60 to 100 piles. I had  to get like 9 janitors, and they still dont clean up all the vomit. Game is not finished. Practically unenjoyable.

As it is an early access game, it is very limited at the moment. Sort of a foundation for a better game that might come eventually. But as of now, I would not recommend it unless you like early access games, and waiting for new updates, watching a bad game grow into something good.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has promise, but it is plagued by glitchiness, bugs, and just general low quality mechanics. They fixed the memory leak apparently (not), and as a whole its much better than the first beta tests, but the spline-based coaster builder system still needs work.

Also the heavy contrasted graphics gives me a headache after a few minutes of playing, but maybe that's just me. Apparently they're going for a retro look, but meh.

Don't buy as is. I'm still holding out for the final release, but I'm worried that with the number of times they've pushed this game back with very little improvement, they'll give up on it.

But hey! At least it's early release, so maybe some good will come from the Steam community

EDIT:--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Turns out they didnt fix the memory leak. I spent 3 hours designing a ride only to have my computer run out of RAM and crash, making me lose all my progress. It's still better than the 20 minutes I had to make a ride in the beta, but FFS devs, fix this! Some/most of us are perfectionists who like to make a good ride!

There's also a painful stutter on turns, and none of the premade rides have any banked turns.

I've been a huge fan of the series, and so far the only innovative" part they've contibuted with RCTW is the spline-based coaster building
date: like in NoLimits2. It's pretty powerful
recommended: but is plagued by memory leaks
hoursPlayed: horrible glitchiness

Things they got right:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The good of a man is often buried with them, but the evil lives on afterwards...

I've been an RCT fan since the very beginning, it was for a time my childhood, before the internet my brother and I would sit side by side on our computers (of which my mobile is now more powerful) and play Roller Coaster Tycoon.
So forgive me in assuming having bought every Roller Coaster Tycoon game and their expansions over the years, for feeling a little disappointed and hard done by.

Prior to buying and downloading, I watched youtube videos and whilst I liked the idea of planet coaster and the other rivals, I stood and was loyal to RCT and went and brought a copy.
Yes, its early access and yes there is a hugh amount of work to be done, but it is not the same and never will be. Its full of amazing concepts and big ideas and on paper if I had $10,000,0000 I would support it or take the ideas and rebuild it myself. but I dont, but they do and they appear to have made a shambles of it.

I log into steam every day to see if there is an update and I read the blogs with interest, hoping and praying that with each next release its fixed, but its becoming an embarassement to the RCT name. There is so much it could do and so much potential, so much that excites me about it... so much I want it to be... But it just isnt.

I'm hoping that (if the developers dont see sense and fly me out to their offices immediately to help fix their mess) that within 6 months this game is fixed and actually playable. I've tried hard to have an open mind and to make this game playable but it just isnt.

My advice if you are feeling thrifty this month is to take the money you would have spent on it and give it all to the next homeless person you see, or if you are not that way inclined, buy yourself and the homeless person a pizza with it, because quite frankly, the way it is right now, you'd both be miles better off in life than you would be if you owned this game.

I'm not saying, don't buy it, you may think its great (if you've been living in a cave since 1999) but if you are expecting a game that is better than I could download for free on my phone, then currently you are looking in the wrong place.

My conclusion you ask?  Is to wait a little and see what happens. I'll keep trying it and if it lives up to my expectations eventually I will recommend you buy it. For now? Stick your credit card back in your wallet, its not even worth the interest let alone the pennies...

Thank god for steam, buying it on a DVD would be an insult to the plastic its burnt into!

I gotta say.. if your building a simulation game, such as a theme park builder, can you guess what is most important?

I mean come on.. we are in 2016 now, if you want to be the next big thing in theme park games, THE AI COMES FIRST. No matter what.
At the moment, they are walking around like they all have constipation.. theres no interaction, no intelligence behind their behaviours.. just little ants walkin' around in circles.
I do agree that you have done a good job with the structural design and the graphics are getting there.. but its the AI that makes me wanna demand a refund...........:S
I hope to see great improvements from this game over 2016. Give it your best shot Nvizzio :)

As the game is today, I would NOT recommend it but I would recommend to wait and see IF this becomes a game worth playing in 6 months or so.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is terrible... like really terrible. It looks NOTHING like the screenshots that were constantly being shared by the developers. The game's graphics are horrible even on the highest settings. Also, the frame rates drop a lot as well. I have a Geforce GTX 960 graphics card with an Intel i7 processor. This is the ONLY game I've played that has horrible graphics on my PC. I'm really disappointed. The anti-aliasing doesn't even work well.

It's not even just the graphics either. The overall gameplay is terrible. Building rides is too complex. It's hard to build a decent roller coaster without coming across too many problems. The controls are too difficult. Also, you can't even change the color schemes of most rides.

This is the first Roller Coaster Tycoon game that I've been upset about. The other three were fine the way they are. Even though RCT3 has its faults, it's still better than this game. Save your money! Do NOT buy this game until it becomes better (if that happens).

I've been a life long fan of the Roller Coaster Tycoon franchise since I was a child! I've been playing since the game was released (1999). This one game has left me horribly disappointed. They ruined this once great franchise! :(

reviewText:
As of right now I can't recommend this game.
I know it is only a beta, but with less than 6 weeks to go until the initial release, it is clear to see that this game is going to need a lot of polishing, so much polishing in fact, that I think that the devs are not going to be able to put a well working game together, by the time this game does launch.

This is a real shame, because I had really high hopes for this game and have been waiting on it for quite some time.

I had hoped everything would have worked the way I wanted it to work, but unfortunately it diddn't.
The coaster editor and builder are very complicated, it even takes a highly experienced RCT player and modder like me, a hell of a lot of time to get used to (let alone build a good working coaster), the cars constantly bump into an invisible wall at the end of the station, making them fall off, or hit some kind of bump on the lift hill and fall through the track.

Also when the cars fall through (and sometimes into) the track, it is impossible to despawn them, making it impossible to go further with your coaster and you might as well delete it as you can't do anything about it.

The snap to grid function is basically non-existent, the grid does not allign properly and this makes it nearly impossible to build straight tracks and paths.

I personally don't think they should have called this a Beta, it can't even be called an Alpha at this stage (in my eyes)
There is still so much work that has to go into this game, that I personally think that the devs and designers should push back the release to give everything a good look over and some polishing.

I still think there is potential in this game though, I hope Atari and NVizzio will iron out all mistakes and listen to what their customers have to say and want, otherwise I think I will back away from this game and get the Opponent's game.

reviewText:
Im not sure why steam allows people to review the game in beta.  Upon downloading this game I did have some difficulties getting it to start (This should be fixed by the release) and there are some lag issues.  I believe the lag issues are because of the preset graphics settings for the game during beta.  People are getting all upset about little problem like these that may easily be fixed by an options menu.  It took me about an hour or two to get used to the controls, and before that this game was frustrating and unappealing to me.  After I mastered the controls of this beta the game became much more enjoyable and appealing.  Having played all three of the previous games this one deffinetely seems like it could be a step up in the future.  Many people are rating this entire game off of the first betas seeminly confusing rollercoaster builder.  I gaurentee you a good portion of the negative reviews are people who just cant move there mouse correctly.  After playing this game for 4 hours and recording 3 videos, here is my pros and cons chart.

Pros:
-Great vertex system of building the tracks.
-New path system is great despite the fact that being symetric is nearly impossible.
-Graphics are a huge step up from rollercoaster tycoon 3
-Interface
-New rollercoaster testing results gui

Cons:
-No options in the first beta (really... this would have fixed a lot of people's problems)
-No tutorial
-No way to change or learn controls
-Overly shaky when riding some rollercoaster (tends to make my head hurt)
-Peeps sometimes just stop going on your rides (understandable con since the peeps are not finished yet)
-Coaster Building was the main aspect of this beta, so all of the coaster settings should be available.

Overall, this game is great to play and despite very little being available this beta I have yet to run out of things to do.

reviewText:
The game is very buggy and it will crash a lot. But remember this is the first beta weekend and we are 2 months away from release. They still have time to bug fix.

The coaster creation has a very big learning curve because the game takes physics into account. Your coaster will not be able to make sharp hairpin curves, you need to bank your turns, slow the coaster down if its doing 90mph in a turn. This is why people are having issues and why it has such a higher learning curve than the other games. They should give you the option of the current system and the original piece by piece for the inpatient.

Content in the game has all but been locked out for the current beta, because they want feedback on the coaster creation system. If you are patient and enjoyed the older games, then yes I reccomend this game, I loved the wild designs I created in my coasters. But again, it has a learning curve, do not expect to just jump right in and make a great coaster, physics, speed, gravity are now factored in, you are not going to make a turn if your coaster is flying at 100+mph.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game does not live up to the RCT name. It would take at least twice as much development as it currently has to get anywhere close. If you're crazy about theme park simulation games, you might find some enjoyment from it, but let me go over the good and the bad.

PROS:
Not limited to a tile system like the previous titles
Coaster builder has piece by piece functionality, although limited

CONS:
No piece by piece structure building like in previous titles
No water rides, transport rides etc
Coaster builder is extremely challenging to work with
--> It uses your camera's orientation and mouse position to orient new nodes
--> Clicking on a node moves it
--> Often tells you that smoother curves are impossible and forces bad track design
--> View of nodes is obstructed when adjustments are deemed illegal, making it hard to fix
--> No smoothing or straightening track functionality
--> Coasters don't slow down due to friction as much as you would expect
--> Coaster supports are unrealistic and don't reappear if removed
--> Brakes don't work properly, causing coasters to fail
--> Block brakes don't work properly, and multiple trains often cause coasters to stop working
--> Height limit is unrealistically low (80m)
Coaster types
--> Missing kiddie coaster, wild mouse, corkscrew coaster, looping coaster
--> Spinning coaster spins irradically, causing high intensity ratings no matter how realistic
--> Launch coaster catapult is too short and launches to height limit (80m) at slowest setting
Peeps are not properly implemented
--> An unrealistic number of peeps visit your park (300+ with just a carousel)
--> Zooming out causes peeps to turn into a slideshow
--> Zooming in fully does a weird blur thing (fake DOF?) causing peeps to disappear
--> Peeps puke, pee, and litter an unrealistic amount, making parks look like garbage
Paths are difficult to work with and not properly implemented
--> Snaps to nodes at the center of pathways rather than the outside edges
--> Ride queues cannot be curved
--> No stairs
--> Cannot place stalls/rides right next to the path, must create a short path connecting each
--> Elevated pathways often clip through the ground
--> Elevated pathways cannot contain path objects like benches
--> Connecting to other path nodes can be extremely laggy
Theming is more limited than previous titles
--> Restricted to generic, western, sci-fi, adventure
Staff is poorly implemented
--> No staff zoning
--> Staff ignores buildings, fences, etc, preferring to phase through them like ghosts
Deleting is poorly implemented
--> No auto delete for scenery when building coasters/paths
--> Delete tool is extremely laggy when mousing over objects
Filling in parks with rides causes FPS tanking (I went from 60 to 14 after building 4 coasters)

tl;dr there are more cons than pros

My recommendation to you is to pre order Planet Coaster while it's only $30. The alpha alone was miles better than RCTW, providing far more content, easy to use controls, and good optimization. Not to mention it's by the studio that made RCT3, so they have experience in this genre and are essentially creating the true successor to the franchise. Planet Coaster is planned to be released this November.

reviewText:
Okay, as a huge fan of the previous games there is a massive gap between old rct and new rct. If you were a fan of old rct do not buy this game. That's the early TL:DR.

Here are the likes
1. Terrain and water editor is nice
2. music isn't bad
3. more coaster editor customization

and dislikes
1. coaster editor is far too complex for average user, even above average users. See below for more details.
2. takes way too long to load sandbox mode. SANDBOX MODE!
3. can't right click to delete things such as pathways
4. MUST move camera with arrow keys, no more mouse movement
5. None of the coaster styles have relevant pictures to determine what they are, only stick figure sillouhetes.
6. you don't have a setting to remove cars from your trains. To add you simply click on where the extra cars should be
7. Terrain editor wont change the already existing support height leaving terrain indents that are quite ugly
8. Scenery isn't separated by group anymore. Oregon Trail Wagons apparently fit in with UFO's and pumpkins.

Here is my report of my experience on coastercrazy.com's forum skype chat regarding the game:
- alright rctw gimme what you got
- the music reminds me of a mix between sims 3 and a merry go round
- really not sure why a sandbox mode took MY $3000 custom build 2 minutes to load
- why can't I right click to delete things?
- can't move the camera with mouse apparently even with the highly unnecessary move tool". you need to use the arrow keys
date: something never needed before. WHAT AN AWESOME NEW FEATUJRE GUISE! [/sarcasm]\n- None of the coaster styles have relevant pictures to determine what they are
recommended:
only stick figure sillouhetes.
- wow the coaster editor... take everything you knew about rct and throw it out the window.
- make a kiddie coaster. A good looking kiddie coaster. What was a 3 minute build is now 15 minutes.
- this coaster editor is way too complex for any casual or even a step above that user
- it's so customizable but that doesn't mean better. Sure it'll be able to make somewhat realistic coasters even WITHOUT A STRAIGHT TRACK SETTING AT ALL but it won't be recieved well by anyone that wants a casual non stressful experience.
- as far as track is concerned imagine a spline editor that automatically detects radius
- they took a simple game idea and added infinitely more steps
- on the bright side making death coasters is way easier
- For extra ride settings
hoursPlayed:
you don't have a setting to remove cars from your trains. To add you simply click on where the extra cars should be.
- THIS IS NOT ROLLER COASTER TYCOON!
- I love this new terrain editor I do but it wont change the already existing support height leaving terrain indents that are quite ugly.
- The water tool works very well and something I really like.
- Scenery isn't separated by group anymore. Oregon Trail Wagons apparently fit in with UFO's and pumpkins.
- Overall a very sub par experience

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright, where should I even start? FIrst of all I played what they called the 'beta' back in november which was a huge disappointment. I couldn't even start the game or it would crash and if it did start it would crash after a few minutes of play time.

Now, that is the only possitive thing I could say about this game atm; it didn't crashed (at least for me). Besides that this is the most expensive early access game I have ever seen and bought and also the most awfull one.

The graphics look like crap. When you zoom out you will notice a square box which is around half of the size of the screen in which all the graphics are rendered, and outside of this box everything looks different/vague. Also the peeps are very pixely and walk like a bunch of idiots.

The interface is just as annoying and malfunctioning as in the 'beta'. Buttons and sliders that won't work and even in the graphics tab it's hard to get to 2560x1440 because it's outside of the settings box.

Both the road builder as the coaster builder are also buggy as hell as, for instance, it is nearly impossible to connect a waiting line and a exit nicely next to eachother to your main path.

I would understand if you would say 'Hey, why be so hard on the devs this is an early access game!', but this 1.2GB game they delivered to us all for $45 doesn't even deserve to be called a beta, let alone be called an early access. I believe the devs should be ashamed of the state this game is in and how little they seemed to have learned from the 'pre-pre-alpha' last november. At least I'm done with this game and getting my refund to save the money for a game that is worth the money.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is not Early Access - it is a shame.

I pre-ordered the game back in october 2015 and expected to get a full game in december 2015 and access to 2 beta-weekends. Now, 4 month after the planned release an only one beta-weekend later they sell this title as early access. At first they must have known in the beginning of december that they wont release the game in 2015, the beta was terrible. Sadly there are almost no noticable improvements over the beta. The performance is bad, graphics are bad, the UI looks like it was made in 5 minutes with MS Paint and the overall content is underwhelming and unpolished. The path system is unintuitive, just like the coaster builder. The animations are horrible, Peeps in RCT3 still have more beauty to them than in this so called game. I did not test the economy in this title - I just coul not force me to play this game longer than I did. It is just terrible.

Atari lied several times. It is ashame what they did to their customers, fans and the RCT franchise.
Shame on Atari - R.I.P RollerCoaster Tycoon

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game needs a huge amount of work.
I was slightly impressed by the manouverabiliy of the rollercoasters and paths, but thats where the good points end.
Graphics are terrible, the guests look ridiculous.
The camera is clumsy to move around, I found previous Rct games had cumbersum cameras but Rtc world has taken a huge step back.
There is hardly any control over the staff, previous games allowed for training and patrol areas, this game doesnt.
I could't get past the tutorial stage before giving up on it.
The game appeared to be advertised as a full finished game, I had to read the news feed to discover it wasn't(After paying for it). I'm not sure if I will be entitled to the full game when its complete, but if this game doesn't see a major overhaul before release I will certainly be looking for a refund.

reviewText:
I was very excited to get my hands on the beta for Rollercoaster Tycoon World, being a fan of the series since RCT2 when I was a kid.

However, the beta has shown that the game is definitely not ready. (Hence the reason why they changed the release date from the 10th to the 29th)

Pros:
The graphics are nice.
Curved paths are awesome.
The game sounds great, from the chains on the coaster tracks to the peep conversations.

Cons:
The camera doesn't work for me half the time.
The new RollerCoaster builder is way too complex for me. There's gotta be a way to simplify it.
The framerate gets pretty bad for me at some points. (From 60 to 10-15)
The game eats RAM like it's candy.

In conclusion; I know it's a beta, and I know the game has tons of potential, but with the release date being right around the corner, I feel like it's going to either get delayed to 2016 or have a crappy launch. I really wish the game becomes the RCT of my dreams.

reviewText:
I really want to give a positive review to this game; but it's not happening sadly.

The game itself has a really good potential. Fans of the franchise will buy the game no matter what; like me. This is of course a beta. The most disappointing thing for me in the beta is the coaster builder. Why? It's not because its so cluncy or problematic. These can be improved. So what is the problem? The problem is how the game is demonstrated for 2-3 months. And when it came to beta; they said that there will only be coaster builder in the first beta, because other parts are not ready enough. So I'm really worried about the other parts of the game; and the whole game itself. If the ready parts is this; (as the developer saying) than it won't be a good game. What I understand from ready is; fluent, not so buggy, and acceptable performance. There is no fluency or ease when building a coaster. If you manage to finish one; and this one would not be the one in your dreams; making it work is another hassle.

I hope the developer work hard and finish this game. But at this stage I'm really disappointed about the the progress. I really hope to see a good RCT game.

Think twice before you pre order.
